required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigator-initiated, Explorative Trial Evaluating the Effect of SAT-008 in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Randomized, Open Label, No-treatment Controlled, Digital Device Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety and Feasibility of SAT-008 in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this exploratory study is to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and feasibility of a novel digital device called SAT-008 in healthy adults.

detailed_description.textblock: This clinical study was designed as a single institution, open, controlled, and investigator-led clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and feasibility of a novel digital device called SAT-008 in healthy adults.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomly assigned to one of two study arms. One group (treatment) will receive an experimental digital device for 13 weeks while the other group (control) will maintain daily activity as usual.

primary_outcome.description: To measure changes in functions of natural killer cells, T cells, and B cells at 1, 5, and 13 weeks compared to baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of expected and unexpected adverse events
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety of SAT-008

To assess a degree to which participants follow SAT-008

To assess a degree to which participants follow SAT-008

arm_group.description: Participants randomly assigned to this group will maintain a routine life without any treatments (no use of SAT-008).
Participants randomly assigned to this group will be treated by SAT-008 during the study.

intervention.description: SAT-008 is a digital device containing several types of activities related to the immune function of adults.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults aged 19 to 50 years
- Received influenza vaccination the previous year
- Scheduled to receive the influenza vaccine
- Voluntarily agrees with a consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current infectious disease
- History of autoimmune diseases
- Current immunological compromised diseases.
